Xc6F_Unbo6Btmwr_YJTRCA.text: The Marquis is lively, with a good mix of locals and students, which, in the hotel infested area around Bloomsbury, this is relatively unusual. Serving a wide range of beers and ciders, and with a reasonable mix of music, the pub is a popular place for Friday or Saturday night drinks. The outside area has seating in the summer, but with a view of either the spectacularly ugly Holiday Inn or the slightly less unattractive Brunswick Centre, it would have to be a particularly hot day to tempt me outside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom

kJPGlqaAtX5j15RI3h4pvw.text: I am just totally fond of this place!  Really wide open spaces, interesting seating, you feel like you can sort of mentally and physically spread out and stay awhile.  The food was on the high side of average, and the drinks were decently priced.  Located in Bloomsbury, you get a smart and interesting crowd of diverse people without having to put up with too many tourists behaving badly.    (DISCLAIMER:  I say this like I'm a townie, but honestly I'm just a really I'm an American recently graduated student posing as a local).  I also like that there is plenty of outdoor seating if you're in the mood for an afternoon pint outside when the weather is decent.  It's also located right across from the Brunswick Center where there are any number of decent chain restaurants to choose from if you're looking for a dinner and date night type feel.

RDtm-qYri6-WJV3_aOjhDQ.text: The Marquis is certainly a bit different from your ordinary pub. It's shied away from dark and dingy with manky smelly beer-soaked carpets, and has chosen a different path altogether. It's bright, clean and spacious, with high ceilings, wooden floors, chandeliers and homely furniture, including some comfy sofas. It makes for a homely feel - indeed, the tiles around the bar are almost exactly like the tiles in my own hallway! They have a great selection of beers, too - mostly Belgian (including two varieties of fruit beer!), but that is not to say they have neglected the ales; they only have a few, but good ones, not too common, like Spitfire. Maybe it's not the greatest pub ever, but it's refreshingly different. And I'm a sucker for that fruit beer.

JdKHK0kVtET2DRt-lIpTRg.text: A good place for a quick beer whilst the partner is spend spend shopping in the fancy brunswick shopping center opposite.Nice welcoming appearance from the outside too,shows they care to have kerb appeal.

pIVLrfaZJ82Xv1NlxAkgqA.text: I wanted to take a large group of people here for Christmas dinner, and was really excited to find this place on the internet. It looked just my thing. I rang to book more than a month in advance. The first guy I spoke to mumbled (English wasn't his first language), seemed very disinterested, and tried to discourage me. Unwillingly, he then decided to pass me onto someone else (again, English wasn't their first language), who had difficulty understanding me  but who was utterly disinterested. After mumbling (aka trying to make stuff up), trying to get out of it  he decided to tell me that they don't take bookings after 5.30pm. I'm sorry, what? After clarifying that I was trying to book over a month in advance, for a large group (guaranteed at least £400) ie not for tonight, and it was good business  he confirmed he understood me, and after more vapid mumbling - went on to say in a completely nonchalant drawl that they get busy on Thursdays, and the place gets full. It seemed actually he wanted to say: I/we can't be arsed; but instead, was making up excuses as he went. Wow. I've lived in London for fifteen years, and have never experienced that; good luck to the business that turns away a guaranteed booking of at least £400, over passing trade. In case anyone is in any doubt, let me make clear that they have a whole section on their website devoted to Christmas bookings, inviting you to book. Good riddance!

F6JT3rzXFPYQhzRuAn5_2Q.text: Really nice local pub in the heart of Bloomsbury. Fires in the Winter, spilling out onto the streets in the Summer sunshine. Wide variety of lagers and excellent food. Thoroughly recommended.

toMtOWgKX5_RA8sQBBt_wg.text: I took two of my American friends for dinner here for their first experience of a British pub and they loved it. I'm veggie, but I was told the fish and chips were good.

LkEFav225h2_ACcAbepUQQ.text: The Marquis of Cornwallis looks very traditional from the outside, and on first glance when you enter, it does remind you slightly of an old man's pub. But look closer, and the seats are comfy, the booths private, and plenty of room to socialise with friends of all ages. Drinks are reasonably priced, with the burgers out of this world, in terms of food. The rooms for hire upstairs are nice and large, and are great for parties. All in all, not a bad pub at all.

-fl_FCdYKUS7NyQJGGEooQ.text: Each time, I come over in London, I always have some drinks in this pub. Such a traditional pub where you get the feeling to be in another time!

MAieYTG9bBhWVXgYnHxEXQ.text: Luckily this is my local and for that I'm truly thankful. Good selection, loads of space and a fairly decent menu - very comfortable, cosy and cheerful.

y60HE8dib5UQbthYT2TE-g.text: The first thing you will do when you attend the Marquis Of Cornwallis, is to have a debate with your mates over wheter the bloke on the signe is Michael Winner or not, I do every time I go and it's a conversation I've commonly overheard. He looks like Michael Winner after a particularly bad spray tan. But enough of that. THe interior decor is similarly odd, looks like someone has had the sandpaper out, though it is nice and spacious with plenty of light but that's no the important part of this pub. It's all about the very interesting range of Continental beers they have on sale, some are more palatable than others, most a bit too fruity for my tastes but there are a few gems. There is also a little designated area for serving coffees, which is a nice touch i think, a better alternative than sitting in a starbucks I reckon. Not the greatest pub in the world but it has character, I like it.

III35BSDlqVnntXRcTvG0Q.text: Really great pub: friendly atmosphere and staff, fast service, decent food: all good!Set ove two levels this pub is very English, with a motley collection of sofas, armchairs, dining tables and high bar tables.Tends to be crowded at key times with a young crowd (local businesses and UCL mainly)Reasonable prices on a good selection of drinks too.

MAIPqr8kVJkPiIguAlJf7g.text: Busy but spacious pub full of media types in their 20s/30s who generally work around the area or spill over from Fitzrovia. Randomly situated across from the Brunswick Centre and a Holiday Inn and other tour bus-friendly hotels, the Marquis is welcoming semi-hidden gem - and it's reasonably priced considering the area it's in.It's multi-level and has plenty of outdoor seating, weather permitting. The highlight though, is definitely the cozy living room-style section on the upper level. Reminded me a lot of the vibe in my local pub, The Washington, especially when I saw the menu. They must be under the same ownership.  Thus I'll have to give it four stars by association!

ZuEh4UzYWrIecDvXZEToeQ.text: Great neighborhood.  Nice big place with fun atmosphere.  There's an upstairs area too.  Very loud and busy on a Friday night - we waited a bit and successfully snagged a table.  Service was friendly, beer was great, fish and chips were tasty.

wC2mkOXLDQlFLtwWDVMNsQ.text: With a lively mix of locals and students, The Marquis of Cornwallis is a relaxed but fun pub just a stone's throw from the famous Brunswick Centre.  The decor is traditional but sophisticated with large heavy wood tables and chairs and more comfortable leather sofas towads the back, there is also a huge bar meaning that drinks waiting times are cut down considerably.  The staff are fiendly and efficient even when things get a little crowded which they invariably do on a Friday evening.The Marquis is an out and out modern gastropub and as such features a welath of tasty but affordable meals from traditional English dishes like cottage pie to more European and Asian oriented food.  Drinks-wise there is a massive selection of wines, beers, ciders and soft drinks catering to all tastes.A perfect place to unwind at lunchtime or after work, the Marquis is a welcome relief from the hectic life of London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom

gChK9BkWYaiqqqhAei9UIQ.text: There aren't very many places to get a good meal on restaurant-strewn Marchmont but the Marquis of Cornwallis is an exception.  Whether you go with a group or individually, you get solid service and a very good choice of meals.  I enjoy the ten pound noontime multiple course option.  And, of course, i never complain about the pint.

hMOAHKRFbXtSihsj2h39YA.text: Sometimes men leer at me when I walk by the Marquis of Cornwallis during the day.One night I got one foot in the door to find what I can only describe as a rave on the ground floor, just without the glow sticks.  The other foot remained outside.But then there was that one time I visited, and the atmosphere was laid back.  The other foot made it inside, and I saw the large well-stocked bar.  Sure, the clientele was a little student-y and tourist-y because of all the halls of residence in the area and the Holiday Inn across the street.  But it's Bloomsbury.  No one lives in Bloomsbury but students and transients.  I went upstairs.  I found lots of comfortable seating in an open floor plan. I found another bar.  I found Fruli!  I found a local boozer.(Except when it turns into Dance Party Extravaganza '09!!!1!)

HJFtpWidNkosGV-Y595raw.text: If you live in the neighborhood and you haven't found a 'local' you should definitely check out the Marquis.  While other reviewers have already noted that there are a great selection of beers and wines here, they did fail to note that this is not a 'big brewery' owned pub.  As anyone who's lived in London for any length of time knows, when you go to the coprorate pubs you are going to be stuck paying 3+ quid for pints of swill.  Not sure where they get their beers but they are very tasty.Not only are there excellent beers on offer, but the Marquis sports very friendly bar staff, DJ's on weekend evenings, excellent food offerings and a great mixed-age crowd.  All of which makes for the best pub in the neighborhood.

wv71wp9VWWMdBCqL25ei1Q.text: My. Favorite. Pub. Perfect on the weekdays and Sundays. Very chill and sprawling with a mixed bag of youngin' and older locals. Perfect on weekend evenings when you want a bit more upbeat, fresh and fun. Not too hip-happening, but there's a nice crowd, a very good music selection (via dj or someone's ipod) with the perfect level of crowdedness to accomodate your friends and to chat up your neighbor. If you're lucky, grab one of the booths in the back corner near the steps.They have a super tasty Sunday Roast (with a good vegetarian option!), but I'd steer clear of the nachos and quesadillas.

QvU80VyEs5xqaY6VU6-dLA.text: The one thing that amazed my American brain when I got to London was the fact that people could drink outside. OUTSIDE!!?!? CRAZY!! So I decided that Marquis would be the place where I would take my drink outside.The sole reason why this place is getting 5 stars because it is HERE where I discovered Bulmer's Pear Cider (on Draft, not to be confused with Magner's/Bulmer's). Thank GOODNESS the original beer I wanted was not available, otherwise Bulmer's would still be unknown to me. So as a thank you, you get 5 stars!Beer definitely tastes better when you can drink it outside. Even though it felt slightly wrong to be walking out of a pub with a drink in my hand, I enjoyed it immensely. :)

U2TFgRfEu9qOYPCWB9MbxQ.text: This pub is awesome,really. Most of all I enjoy the fact that you can choose from a really great variety of beers and to tell you the truth I will be checking the taste of each one.

JQ4NcWR0_Y0CvDWHAaUJoA.text: Great pub, good range of beers, large area, lots of tables, great relaxed atmosphere. Will definitely be back

BhvvJLRVy4ZjB_bx0FY2EA.text: The burgers are salty but the alcohol is great. get there early for a better selection of food.

J74Li5gbXmS4WhKmUCSV1Q.text: Bright, upscale look of this neighborhood pub is refreshing.  Food is quite good; roasted salmon special was excellent.  Decent selection of beer/ale on tap.  Can get busy and loud on the street level; quieter room upstairs is nice.

doXqHQfn-lJYchcBmY1iUg.text: 2012 This pub seems to be getting better and better for beer. On a recent (ish) visit I enjoyed 2 really fine ales. Moor Summerland Gold and some kind of Lemongrass beer. I noticed a keg stout too. 2011 This is a large dimly lit pub near the hideous Brunswick Centre. Probably not my favourite style of pub, but my priority at the end of the day is good beer! The Tribute was in perfect nick (although I did have to ask for a top up) and they also had keg Sierra Nevada Pale ale, the 2nd best tasting orange drink in the world! (after Irn Bru). Named after an extinct peerage title.

S41NeKXOObYhrrd5NDUypw.text: 5 stars for the Sunday roast because we haven't really been for anything else. It's a chain like so many pubs in this city, but the roast here is hands down the best in Bloomsbury. The Yorkshire pudding is amazing, the meats are usually great and tender, the potatoes are usually perfectly cooked crispy on the outside, and the dessert never ever disappoints (they have a caramel sea salt tart that is amazing). We've gone maybe 6 times for Sunday roast, and we have wanted to go more but they've run out before we could get our act together and get over there.

CRHA-Y3IK_45YTEMqkw2Tg.text: The Marquiss of Cornwallis is a great pub, it has a really nice feel to it inside and good atmosphere with plenty people spilling out onto the pavement in summer. I've not tried the food yet, but it does look good from what I've seen of it so I'm sure I will.

M1e_nlfUNUgxfO_SQHoRIQ.text: Solid pub! Very large selection of pints, affordable even for those of us working off the dollar. The food is good and their tables are nice and big. One of the girls behind the bar was a bit of a b to my friend and I, but I'll forgive that this time. Every single time I've visited London, I've wound up here unintentionally. Next time, the visit will be intentional. I think that if I lived in London, this would be my place.

VoP3ElVRznJz668ryisPmw.text: As my local pub, I really enjoy the beer on tap as well as food here. Their calamari is delish...and it's always bound to have people in it. I had my birthday here on a tuesday and there was just enough places for my friends and I to sit. On the weekends, it's much more crowded. I wish the music would be a bit better, but I absolutely enjoy the atmosphere....minus a mean french bus boy.

-w8uPmNNPi4RdE404Cm7AQ.text: My family and I have been looking forward to trying this place for quite some time. I went over to inquire about a reservation for tonight and they said it wasn't necessary, and to just come in as they would be happy to serve us. A mere hour later, we all show up and are immediately told by an INCREDIBLY rude hostess that the restaurant is out of food and that they cannot accommodate us. To make matters worse, even though we all CLEARLY spoke English and conducted ourselves in a very civilized manner, the hostess literally mocked us to our face by speaking really slowly, over-pronouncing words, and using hand gestures to communicate the restaurant's inability to serve us, eventually just saying "we. have. soup" and shooing us away. I am so taken aback that we were treated this way, especially when we were told such a short time prior that we would get served with no issues. I understand that the holiday season is stressful, but that is no excuse to be openly rude to people trying to give a restaurant business. Even though I was looking forward to eating here, it would take a lot to get me back.

LQtGfNNRmnCpaDoe01THNw.text: My colleague and I found this by accident on the way to Kings X station and said that we'd come back next time we were in the area. Now every time we're at Birkbeck or near Russell Square we stop in either for lunch and/or a drink. The furniture is a mish-mash of comfy chairs and sofas, benches and high stools and there are more private areas at the back of the bar, although we like to sit by the big windows near the bar. They have a good menu, everyone's always happy with the food which says a lot considering we all have different tastes! They have a good range of beers, wines and soft drinks, great for a quick drink or a leisurely afternoon. The only problem we've had is with a barmaid who didn't speak English and didn't seem to understand what we were trying to order which was a little frustrating I ordered a lime and soda and ended up with a lager and lime!

YDMxzIAmFzdH9695F3pXIQ.text: Wide variety of beer selection, food tasty but a bit pricy, friendly staff and great atmosphere! Make sure you'll be there on time and try to avoid rush hour, especially when planning to stop there for food.Burger is delicious, average size, if you're hungry dobt forget a starter

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Desert for sharing: lime & lemon crumble tarte, brownie an vanille ice cream and salted caramel tarte
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Homemade Country burger served with chips
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Salmon fishcakes with potato vedges

dxa85k6giBcGkUjIp01euw.text: Large open atmosphere with great ambiance...checkSelection of delicious pints at a good price...checkDelightfully good food to settle that craving...checkExcellent service and friendly staff...checkMarquis of Cornwallis is a new favourite.  I don't get to London frequently, but this will without question be a destination for me each trip from now on.  Delicious Sunday roast with perfectly cooked meat and veg, a great selection of drinks to wash it down with...couldn't get much better than this.

UZQnLT7hk5YqikELaJlEgw.text: Absolutely everything a British Pub should be.  I can't wait to come back here! The drink selection was good, the kitchen was open late for us to get a bite-- altogether a great experience. The music is a bit loud, but still quite tolerable.

pbCwCzS-CrJNOeXjYDMssQ.text: House red was drinkable and an enjoyable atmosphere with friendly staff. Uncertain I would eat here again as the beefburgers was overcooked and dead like a cow I hit in the Midwest. The pistachio nuts were great up until the point that an unsavoury sour stinking taste hit my palate. Oh deaty me. Stick with the alcohol and one should be fine.

Fq9nOjCCfIzouNovkrB9sg.text: Finally, a real pub!I had been underwhelmed by the pubs I visited in a recent trip to London, but my visit to the Marquis of Cornwallis gave me hope.  They had decent food, decent beer, decent staff, decent atmosphere.  Unfortunately, a change from most of the pubs we visited up to that point.This will be a fav, and go-to location for future visits. :)

aibB07cvhe5jzXPvm5k8Xg.text: The Marquis of Cornwallis saved our trip to London. We stayed in the area because of its close proximity to St Pancras station. But it wasn't the best choice to arrive on Christmas day when London is a ghost town and the only people out are the tourist zombies. MoC was open on Christmas day but unfortunately we didn't discover it until Boxing Day. I could've had every meal here. We had the lunch prix fixe with fried white baitfish (amazing) and 6 oz steak frites, a bargain at about 12£. Also had the chorizo and pork burger. Coming from California, I appreciated the quality food that wasn't bland, boring, or greasy. We came back later that night for the sticky toffee pudding. I asked about breakfast since I really wanted to return the next day for my last meal but that's only served on Saturday. The beer selection is great. Again, it's OPEN ON CHRISTMAS. We walked for hours trying to find decent food in the city and ended up with overpriced Indian and random fried chicken. We walked to a few places that the food blogs said would be open but weren't. So disappointed we didn't have Christmas dinner here especially since it was so close to our hotel.

xNlWF62DnHbAVC6VXCdrZA.text: Great Pub, early Sunday afternoon had a terrific Sunday Roast. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, low noise level and tables not too close together. Roasts from £12 - £14 and desserts from £4.50 - £5.50.Pleasant atmosphere.

TM2J5bF1WatuFWA530MPNg.text: Terrible experience here, I'm afraid to report: gave the barkeep a £20, got change for a £10, then told it was actually a £10, and that I was wrong. It was the only place open for dinner one Sunday that I could find, so, despite being robbed of £10, I ordered food, which another barkeep told me was a la carte, and sides were necessary - but the food was not a la carte, and I wound up with three times more food than I could eat. Plus it cost, overall, at least £20 more than it was supposed to, which made me quite irritated, and avowed never to return. Worst dining experience in a long while.

e3lEDIc_pMTD1c2W5wqj0g.text: Nice pub! On Wednesdays there is a great deal (burger plus beer for 10 £)

ZodZu7uyF1DzDfqiHpH1OQ.text: I like the Marquis of Cornwallis... okay I *really* like it. I've had plenty of nights here chatting and drinking with friends and strangers.Whenever I have friends in town, this seems to be the place to take them. They have a great selection of beers on tap, the menu isn't bad, and the crowd is considerably young... which is great for my friends who want eye-candy. Being in proximity to the LSE, SOAS, and Central St. Martins means there is something for my friends that have preferences for econ-nerds, internationals, to artsy hipsters. The average age is pretty low, though depending on the night means there are plenty of suits around as well. So there is even something for the more "business" inclined women. If you're a good wing-woman, you should keep this place marked. ;-)

Yo5mLOhz8bAOfIiZDpCFiw.text: Good standard British pub in a good location - whether you're a student or business person and the atmosphere is friendly; welcoming and good. Warning, everytime I've visited it's been packed so make sure you get yourself there early. The service is good and there is a good range of drinks whether on tap or bottled. Close to St Pancras; King's Cross and Russell Square, so very convenient.

oOuEOaX3Lw022OWwdp2moA.text: It was raining hard and I needed cover. The Marquis of Cornwallis welcomed me in. The bar is spacious with tables and chairs dotted around the floor in a non-linear fashion, with the odd couch and booth style seat against he walls. There is an upstairs area that is also spacious and has a living room vibe that is soothing.The bar itself has a great selection of draught and for its location it isn't expensive. The food menu although I didn't try it had an above average contemporary pub selection.Marquis would not be a destination pub for me. It looks good, has decent menu's and had a very impressive crowd for 4:30 in the afternoon, but paid for wifi is a big turn off.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom

0jlb1N1h0dIBEC5mUft8Pw.text: The Marquis of Cornwallis is a pub on Marchmont Street. It is quite large, set across two floors. Both floors are open plan. The ground floor is larger and smartly decorated. The upper room is smaller and looks more like a traditional pub. Both floors have a bar which is fully stocked with a good selection of beers.The crowd is mixed in terms of ages with many students as well as tourists and local workers. The staff are efficient and pleasant enough. Though it is quite fun and lively at night I prefer it as a place for daytime drinking.It is also alongside the Brunswick centre and so ideal for a drink before a cinema or after shopping.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom

leVQQf81IPGLkhjZ3cHXNg.text: Perfect spot in the neighborhood. Great food and atmosphere. A nice blend of pub feel and family friendly.

nI8MiDby5W8sd0KtPF8QUQ.text: As previously stated this pub is pricey. The pints were a fiver which isn't insane by London prices but still above great places like Euston Tap and Some brewdog beers. Food was even more so. But the beer selection was ace. So was the feel of the place. So only 1 star knocked off.

KkMNVkUjUuZFLA2rQWWHqw.text: slightly more refined version of the local British pub.    its quite a large open and light space.  somewhere you could sit for a while consuming copious pints.  i would easily give 4 stars if i was just drinking here.  nice selection of drinks and some craft beers too....but my wife and i ordered some food which was average to say the least.  its a shame because when we ordered around 2:30pm after the lunchtime rush had ended...if i'm in the area ill be back here to drink ..but never to eat again..

GLw2I2otLuYVDiQHua1Baw.text: A great, relaxed pub with great food.  The best chicken, ham, and leek pie is maybe the best I've had in London.  Also a good cider selection.

RGt-qnR3KNIt45B8_U0WSw.text: I do like this pub. It's a real saviour in a sea of drab and fake hotel pubs and soul-less fake Italian eateries!Just round the corner from Russell Square, I don't get to drink here that often save for the times I'm heading to the Bloomsbury Lanes or meeting friends who work nearby.I like that people stand outside in the summer too.Big and spacious, over two floors, you can usually get a table quite easily and their food menu is really quite decent and fairly priced.They sell Sierra Nevada on tap - Billy Bonus.

ef89kuNIDg7OjFbUWyHn7w.text: Used to visit here many times when it was still The Goose. I think it's much better now. I only went for drinks in the evening. While they were a bit pricey I was happy to see they had many cask ales to choose from and plenty of seating upstairs and downstairs. Atmosphere was lively and relaxing. Next time we visit we'll have to try some food - the menu sounded great.

UQH7y90kZ8VogDMk_3XN6A.text: Very unfriendly service and incredibly dirty wine glasses with traces if lipstick... The most expensive wine tasted like vinegar and the beef roast was as hard to chew as my grandmothers leather bag. Absolutely over-rated, this one!

GT0N-OBDHtsl7u0YIVKnIg.text: Dropped by here to catchup with some mates, they ended up deciding to stick around here for a few beers and dinner.  The place was good and the staff were nice and friendly so I decided I should also grab some dinner, we all ended up going with the burger.  The burger was a little bit smaller than expected it was tasty and a good meal.  I would certainly recommend dropping by here for a burger if you are in for a nice pub meal.  They also have a much larger range of food items but I can only recommend the burger I had.

3jruA-Rr14X0stHdX85OyA.text: I went there a few times. If you visit Marquis, I suggest you try the handmade West Country beef burgers and the Ox cheek pie. This both dishes are a pleasure for your taste buds.If you go at lunchtime, you can choose from a big variety of tasty sandwiches. The atmosphere is pleasant and welcoming, totally a place you would eat at.Prices are maybe too high, but that's just my opinion.

wX6F03gEp7JwMtgwJBekzQ.text: For my first night in London I wanted to hit up a stereotypical English pub. After some research on my handy Yelp app I found the Marquis Cornwallis, which also happened to be two short blocks away from the Royal National where I was staying. I meandered over and found an upbeat English pub full of young people enjoying a drink after work. It was exactly what I was looking for and I was lucky enough to grab a table in the crowded bar. I was surprised to see they had my favorite beer, Blue Moon, but made myself try an English beer I'd never had before. I was not disappointed and enjoyed my beer while taking in the atmosphere. I also had dinner and went with their macaroni and cheese and the chorizo plate. Both were delicious and I ended up adding the chorizo to the macaroni and cheese (they should make this a menu item!). Two beers and an awesome meal later I left the Marquis Cornwallis sated and having experienced the English pub I was hoping for. Try it out!

BuCnyAtWV5kaGSyil9JfgQ.text: This place is easily 4 stars on a normal night, but on this occasion everything worked against it's favour and only 3 was possible. I'll explain.The Place is split over 2 floors. At 7pm, downstairs was bustling with life. Plenty of patrons there for after work drinks. Luckily we had a reservation for the dining floor upstairs which had a much more ambient setting with lower noise levels. The way it works here is no table service. You need to order drinks and food at the bar and it will be brought to your table, or in the case of drinks, be collected at the bar. It's like Wetherspoons, but whilst Wetherspoons are a tightly run ship, Marquis here began it's descent.We ordered drinks and the card reader was having an off night because it was declined from some machines, then the backup seemed to lose wireless connectivity, making what should take 1 minute, take about 3-4. To save time, we opened a tab and was told drinks would be brought to us. 15 minutes later no drinks. I had to go back to the bar and request them again. Next I went up to order food. Suddenly a memo appeared at that exact moment from the dumb waiter. No more burgers for the night. No explanation why. Just no. So went back to table, got everyone's revised orders and went to order. 30 mins or so later we were eating. Phew.The food itself was very very good. The southern fried chicken is standout. Buttermilk fried, tasty delicious. I could have had it to myself. The pork belly was exceptionally good too. Tender, moist. Everything was great down to the sticky toffee pudding..mmm. Which made the disparity with the service that little bit more annoying. There was one barmaid serving the whole first floor. That's both drinks and food and billing. Way too much for one person and it showed. I can't really attribute blame to them, particularly as they appeared to be doing their best and was super apologetic. Table service, even just one extra staff member would really help in the food area. Now I had no problem with having to go up to the bar. But if that process isn't working, table service is the best alternative until it's fixed.In all honesty, I want to give this place a 4 and without all the troubles it easily is. It's a nice place to impress in a relaxed environment with top notch food. It's just that 4 stars says "there's really not much to improve" and that is far from the case on the service side.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding with vanilla pod ice cream
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Trio of desserts with ice cream
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Mac n' Cheese

kogFg9JQar3ccbh92RTAAg.text: The pub itself is nice. Decent space, room between tables, room at the bar, etc. I went yesterday for a roast with some friends, and it just wasn't very good, though. We ordered at the bar as you do, one after the other, with my partner and I ordering second out of six orders. A few people ordered the pork roast and it came without crackling - though the menu indicated it came with it. A quick question and, not 5 minutes later, they had crackling on the table. After about 10 minutes, my partner and I questioned where our food was and we were told it was on it's way. Then we were told it was just going to be a few minutes. About 25-30 minutes after everyone had ordered - and some plates had been cleared! - our meal arrived. At least it was hot, right? Except my partner's "beef roast, no gravy" was covered in gravy, absolutely bathing in it, and my chicken roast was dry and just not cooked very well. It also only came with two small pieces of carrots, what? And the potatoes just tasted... off. When we mentioned to the manager on duty that our food was served so long after everyone else's, we were told it was because we had ordered last and the kitchen does tickets in the order they're received. Fine, except we ordered before everyone except one person. So, no, that's not an excuse. When we clarified that, the manager kind of shrugged and apologised. He ended up comping our meal which we didn't know until we went up to close the tab, which was a very nice gesture - but the whole experience just left a bad taste in my mouth. Also, the place was only about 2/3 full, so it shouldn't have been too bad in the kitchen, especially considering a lot of people didn't seem to be eating.

jWV2PTEA7iDTYUdGL1ignA.text: Really good place to eat, drink, & hangout. Would come back again if I return to the area.

i4BmkDgboQ_YXqQFvElgoQ.text: While I was at uni nearby, this became our local for the year, so I have very found memories of this place and it's always nostalgic going back. I can't say how much of the menu I've eaten (80-90%), but the food's always been incredible and the staff have always been amazing. They're always really friendly and up for a laugh, and if you go in enough they really get to know you. It's one of those places that you can sit in all day if you want. If you do want to eat in the evening, then it's always better to go upstairs past 6pm as the bottom half get's very busy most days of the week. But the local crowd are well-natured and there's always a good vibe.If I was to make any negative comment, it's that it can be pricey in terms of drinks (£5.60 for a G&T in a tumbler, not a long glass). But no more than most other places I suppose.

TeG_kiKX_HxtHI8eNSWvlg.text: This pub is well situated near Russell Square Tube and The Brunswick Centre, it has nice beers and ciders on tap and does nice food. I have been here a few times and it is always busy, so it can be hard to find somewhere to sit, there is an upstairs too with seating and a bar. It is a good pub and a good location, I just wouldn't go out of my way to visit it, but if I was in the area and needed a drink, I'd go.

hX-dS19XgBeGs1fSjLjzCw.text: Came here for food after a long flight and a brief British Museum visit. Order at the bar. Good was mixed, the kiddos salad had chicken, the same smoke chicken and bacon salad my mom ordered had no chicken. The British chicken pie was good. At around six there were more folks having a drink than eating, the atmosphere was loud but nice pub. The girl who served the food didn't really have a response to the lack of chicken.  Bottom line: it was good if you get what you ordered.

Ot05rHiVNQeiRrlmOAHM_g.text: When I lived in London, this was always a good pub to frequent. Whether it be for afternoon drinks, Sunday Roast, or a night of imbibing with friends, the Marquis Cornwallis was always a good spot.

kKnNy5hKPlnRyj40HfdRkg.text: Stopped by for some starters and drinks on our last night in London and this place did not disappoint. Enjoyed basic London ale and split three starter dishes which left us fully satisfied with assorted flavors and textures of meat, dips, and veggies. Great service, friendly and lively atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Three starters (board for sharing, meat, and hummus)

1r7UIBazrNJJg3HNvj_kDg.text: This place is nearly always packed on weekday evenings. Without reserving a table you can be lucky to get in after 5pm.Aside from that the range of drinks is extensive and the bar snacks are pretty good. it's a great place for work do's or after work drinks and has outdoor seating for the summer months. I recommend the sweet potato wedges YUM!

K2JoMSUUaSTOBdg9NgBF3A.text: Decent pub, good location, really close to Russell Square and Bloombury area.  Came here on a Sunday and keen for Sunday Roast. Appreciate it was the evening, however, they were out of all roast options except for Chicken.Got the chicken which was dry - but reason for the low rating is the trimmings weren't good. There wasn't any turnip or cabbage and minimal carrots and peas.  Roast potatoes were soggy - all in all it wasn't impressive.We came with a group of 10+ and appreciate not everyone would get their selection for roasts as it was late in the day, however, almost everything on their menu was not available except for burgers!  So it was either Chicken (they only had 4 left) or burgers. Not the nicest pub experience.Looking at the other reviews, it appears the people who are new to London rate this pub highly, however, the people who know about London pub food rate this low.  I wouldn't bother going here again, there are so many more options!

EVfeMqTt3k9N9_SIuWvotw.text: Honestly in a city ravaged by chain pubs, the Marquis of Cornwallis offers a very high class environment while seemingly avoiding the chain-tag. Though I am never surprised to find out something is a chain, this doesn't appear to be one.This pub doesn't have the greatest prices in this century, but is a good place to grab one pint. Food prices hover around the 10+ pound range so again, this isn't a cheap place, but is is quite nice! Coming in here for a pint or two is all I'd recommend if you are on a budget.The seating is extremely comfortable and the pub is very spacious, including a second level. It has a wholesome feel and is very very clean. Staff is semi-eager to usher you out after you've finished your pint, but they won't do anything about it if you sit around talking.The selection of beers on tap is another plus; there are several microbrews and the standard mainstream beers. It's worth trying something new at this place, the local taps are tasty as hell!! (is hell tasty?)Overall, this place is a grand slam (baseball reference). A true touchdown (american football reference) of the sphere of pubs in London. Honestly, it's a slam dunk (basketball reference). Hole in one (golf).

AtXVHzYBQqbPKoU24zzQfw.text: My local was so fancy!Great pub truly a semi-upscale spot that you could bring your after work crowd or pre-club friends to.The service is great. The guys are a fun bunch both downstairs and upstairs, always good for a chat and quick laugh and knowledgeable of all the menu and drinks. I think I have been enough times to have had all what's on the menu and it's all really really good. Love the burger and risotto the most, but you can't go wrong ordering anything on here. Great for group events as well. I've seen many spots reserved for office parties, and early hen dos and such. With it right next to the Russell Sq station and Kings Cross, it's a pretty good location as well. AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, they have sticky toffee pudding. Really that by itself deserves a star, am I right? *self five*

8btAgsckV8zemW3G3NPXSw.text: 5 STARS FOR ONE REASON AND ONLY ONE REASON: STRAWBERRY FRULI ON TAP (basically my favorite thing in the whole entire world). It's so, so good. I feel so insanely deprived being nowhere close to London at the moment.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry Fruli

Os_f4Rsu1cn1K19EbOyGkw.text: Nice place to stop in and meet a friend for a beer. Nice selection on tap and the service is good. Lunch was decent.

4tBxvHjKffA--JAptRyJfA.text: Now I used to go to uni just up the road from this place but never knew it existed. So, when celebrating a uni friend been awarded his PhD, I was happy that we chose the upper bar in this gastropub right by Russell Square tube. I was a bit late, entered in a hurry and bumped into a party of men in tuxedos with bow ties and goblets of brandy. Wow, I felt underdressed! Thankfully that wasn't a dress code I happened to miss and I quickly fell in the arms of my more normally dressed friends to drink the night away.Nice gastropub style here, really good amount of space and didn't feel too crowded even though the atmosphere was good. We eventually took over the top floor with our party of people which always helps! Drinks at about £4 a pint is pretty expected in Fitzrovia, a bonus given that oyu expected to pay more given the decor of the place.Didn't have any food but it looked like good quality gastropub menus (I always approve of a pub with a snack menu when it includes a scotch egg!)Kicked us out at midnight, can't moan about that on a weekday!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Upstairs bar

sJ9sSurqYHBmgiqYAprOmQ.text: I was looking forward to a meal and a pint here based on yelp reviews but was turned down. I was told by the bartender that I had arrived with 2 minutes to spare to order, but then was told they had shut down the kitchen. So, I try to make the best of the trip and grab a pint and sit down to figure out my plan. 15 minutes later someone is served a burger and fries right behind me....which I know doesn't take 15 minutes to make. Really poor customer experience! Only reason there are two stars was that the beer I tried was solid.

zi2WtQy7u0_9xSNzNNgXGg.text: Another wonderful pub not owned by "Mega Pub Corp." Fresh food, phenomenal Sunday roasts, great beer selection, even some Belgians by the bottle if you are not in the mood for a hand pulled pint or cider. Crackling on the pork Sunday roast was, well Crackling! Ox cheek pie just divine, only minus one star cause it is popular so a bit crowded and noisy.Update just here again and the lamb shank was great the upstairs was quiet at 6 PM on a Friday and just a great relaxed place

ga5e4LpZQT_lMLDb_gvoNg.text: Stopped here for a early dinner. There were a nice selection of tables from benches, high tops, and tables. We ordered the fried camembert cheese with cranberries, Scottish eggs, a meat board and fish n chips. Everything was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom

rU71mOdsF00QjSJLepJ8Ew.text: Great pub experience! The decor in this place is well thought out, very laid back locals vibe and the menu is traditional English with some unexpected items.My husband and I found this on Yelp looking for something to eat for an early dinner. When we turned on to the street I knew exactly where it was because of all the locals outside. I loved my goat cheese and beet tart. It was oozy and the flavors worked wonderfully together. In addition to our entrees we ordered the chips. GET THEM! These were the best chips we had on our London trip. They were cut to exact same (large) size, super crispy and well seasoned.Drinks are very reasonable with a good selection of beer options and wine available in two different sizes.(This is a pub, so go up to the bar, order you food/beverage and pay. Make sure you look for your table number if you're ordering food!)

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Look at those beautiful colors (goat cheese and beer root tart)
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Goat cheese and beer root tart
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom

b4RfDZ9ZnvixTf7pv96Btg.text: Fantastic Pub, any time of day.  The staff are fantastic, happy and helpful.  The interior is clean and traditional with a lot of space to stand or sit.  The menu looked delicious, but it was morning when I dined, so I opted for the veggie English breakfast, sans beans.  Delish!!  Everything was perfectly cooked and tasted great.  I emphasize the service, seems like all the workers there care about the place...will visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom

jvLk98BOvGbQIikTqo32Cw.text: My husband and I were staying in the Bloomsbury area and The Marquis Cornwallis was our go-to pub. Excellent selection of beers, and food was great too (had the fish and chips, and sausage and mash). I like the ambiance - it was never too loud (I am from New York City, where the noise levels at bars can get quite deafening), but also quite busy on some weeknights as it seems be popular among the locals. There is a bar on the ground floor, and another one on the second floor. The second floor tends to be a bit more quiet, if that is what you are looking for.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Second floor - a bit more quiet. There is also a bar here to order from

2hBirRShyLNAyHYqs_WZRA.text: Friendly bartenders and workers with a great atmosphere! The manager gave us free food and was all smiles. Very fun yet relaxed pub! Good for young people!

r-FeVYpqA0jDI8e2TLxnYw.text: Nice pub, comfortable tables and fresh draught beers. Pleasant service as well.

VX-4PinXCHbmXWFHFH1PDw.text: The service is quick. The staff is friendly and on point with your order. My favorite dish has to be the calamari.

jb3wgvxLeMe-CYneNCGXiw.text: Everything about this place was a bad experience. Walked in, didn't see a host/ess (not sure if that's a usual thing in London or not, but I've been greeted in other establishments here so I wasn't sure), so I asked someone and they rudely told me just to pick a seat and order at the bar. I picked a seat, draped my shirt over the chair, and went to order at the bar. I was informed by the bar that you need to know your table number, there's no indication as such (even a couple Londoners didn't know) and it turns out it's a tiny little medallion on the table. Not exactly conspicuous or clear as to what it means. So I go back to my table and I see that my jacket it missing. I start asking the couple next to my table and they didn't see anyone grab it, so I was a little worried someone took it. The individual from earlier informed me a group had sat down so he took the jacket, I said my jacket was there before the group, and he angrily corrected me saying he thought the group had left before I got there and maybe someone left the jacket so he took it away. Another couple had claimed those seats by then, so I lost my seat (but thankfully got my jacket back). Went up to the bar and ordered something, was informed it's no longer available, so ordered something else, same story, so he offered a substitution. During all of this he asked me to hurry up with the order about 5 or 6 times as "the kitchens closing in three minutes!" (complete with hand gesture). Because of that I didn't get a good chance to read over the menu, and ordered hastily. My food comes and it's completely not what I expected. The original guy sees me look at it disappointed and asks if that's what I ordered.  I explained to him what happened and he just said "sorry!" and walked away. Everything here was unclear, the staff was incredibly rude, and to top it off I inadvertently broke a queue (that I was at the front of) when the table number/jacket thing happened, so to top it off I got nasty looks. As I walked away I heard him apologizing to people for me. Very rude. Yes, I see this could all be a one off situation but they could have compensated with a pint or a HALF pint for crying out loud, or offering to change my order. Instead all I got was an awkward insincere sorry and left with a dish I have no desire to eat. So the only thing I can do is leave them this bad review. If I hadn't paid already I would have just walked out. Unfortunately I'm on the hook.

0B9PNCHYzfQxmyVGDt4UGQ.text: Just looking for a classic London pub with good beer, lots of laughter and fish and chips.  The fish and chips were excellent.  Among the best I've had.  Hot. Not greasy at all.  Crispy and tasty.   Mushy peas good.  Beers excellent.  Service friendly.  The downstairs was pretty full so we had to go upstairs.  More room, less noise, but less ambiance.  Still pretty good.  There was a large group up there drinking plenty of pints, eating food and having lots of laughter together.   I would definitely go there again.   Good call.

S0LPXZSKhi5lkSFg29thbQ.text: This pub is really cute and fun to be in! The drinks are great, servers are kind, and the food is amazing! They carry my favorite cider, which is a bonus. I've only ever had great service here. Highly recommend!!!!

BfoVElkUYN4SZ_o8hisglQ.text: My first time here on my second trip back to London!Found this great little pub to get some "hangry pain" satisfaction taken care of!What a great hangout! It reminds me of my days back home at another popular joint I would brings my friends too.The vibe is a mix of young and old folks but I will let you know this place can get loud. That's fine by me!Typical England style, order all your items then pay, then the food will be delivered while you are enjoying your pint of beer.I had my mom with me and we were sitting in a row of small tables, when the person next to us also happen to be from the USA from Las Vegas! It's a small world after all...The food arrive in perfect timing, hot and delicious! My chicken pie was amazing, the crusty, flaky outside with a nice hot filling of chicken and white gravy. My mom's fish and chips were just as good!If you're ever in the Euston area of London, come have some pub fare and a couple of pints, in sure you'll enjoy the same great service that I did!Shout out to our waiter! He said Karen, but I think I neighbor heard incorrectly!NJoy!:)

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Brilliant way to do more with less!
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Chicken pie with mash and veggies - this was my favorite!
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips, super flaky with a crunchy crust!

1fmBPhECc-At-2PUAHjE2Q.text: If you're traveling in London and looking for a British Pub experience, then this place will do it for you.  Especially on Friday and Saturday evening you will have a lively, noisy pub.  Tip: you have to order at the bar and pay up front.  If you worry about pub food not being good, that is not the case here.  The chicken and leek pot pie and mushroom risotto were excellent.  The Guinness beer and ale were also an important part of the British Pub experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Almond pastry with chocolate cream and hazelnut ice cream.
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Chicken pot pie!

xm4VWGmP3dNwjytCcns7rw.text: Casual seat yourself and order at the bar environment. This establishment seems to attract a younger uni-style crowd which is cool. Ordered the fish and chips which were actually quite oily. Massive piece of cod though, which reflects the more expensive menu price for it. Atmosphere was really cool- authentic British style pub with nice decor. Servers were off about doing their own thing... Not too attentive at all. Quite sub-par service with only 2 workers visible during our visit. Chips were average, which was surprising seeing as I expected heaps more quality coming from London. They weren't soggy, but they could have definitely had a nicer crisp to them. The tartare sauce was the saviour of the meal. Amazing tartare for sure! Beef burger patty was big- an impressive amount of ounces for sure! It was juicy and had amazing chipotle sauce. Chips were thinner cut and crispier, although again they could have been made with a much bigger crunch to them!

QOdKp3uniweX_UYXpoXnfg.text: This pub was in a good location, close to Russell Square. The food was good. My complaint is that they play super loud music- it was hard to have a conversation without yelling, which I found very annoying for dinnertime.

5GTqVnogWhqtoa80G5cWEQ.text: The quintessential English pub experience. Menu items are perfectly executed: Shepard's pie, fish and chips, hamburger. Service is friendly and fairly quick. Lots of delicious local beer from which to choose.

deIS2xf0gmMJyx5Riehc2Q.text: The atmosphere feels more upscale than a traditional English pub, but still very come-as-you-are. Delicious classic dishes and plenty of beer options.

mCg6g5KdQHWQ-eweaV5Vkg.text: We stopped in here while walking from the British library to the museum. We weren't expecting too much, but honestly, the meal was really decent.Sadly, I don't remember the beer names. For food, I had the fish and chips, which was quite delicious: hot and crispy, with a nice tarter sauce. The chips left a little to be desired and the mash peas did not suit my palate at all.My son had the roasted chicken which was really the superior meal here. The chicken was quite nice and the parm crusted chips were good as well. If you're in the area and hungry, this is not a bad choice. The venue was a little bit interesting, with a revolutionary war painting overlayed with star wars light sabers that really lit up and a death star.

YdDI4t22RsmJyneiye-s4g.text: Dined and enjoyed the brewskies on two consecutive evenings.On both occasions the service was slow and inattentive.Not exaggerating, the first beer order took at least 20 mins, and refill was forgotten.Being a tourist from NYC, didn't want to be a demanding pain. But this would not happen in NYC, so why London?Small Other Gripe:  why the credit card swipe upon being seated and again when time to pay?  I asked and was told they have problem with deadbeats. Really.If you think this review with photo is useful, funny or cool, I'd appreciate your feedback below.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Fine London Pale Ale with Grilled Salmon

tiR6w2KlNNadB-vgYBbxcA.text: I headed here for lunch whilst staying round the corner for the weekend. There is plenty of bars and pubs to choose from in this area so much so you'll be hard pushed to choose a place! We stumbled past this little gem and managed to bag the last seat outside which surprisingly in London wasn't too busy with cars or taxis. There was 5 us but only 4 eating - this is the type of place you can sit and relax and there was plenty of people both in and out doing just that early afternoon! I opted for a Aperol Spritz given the sunny day which was so refreshing and served with plenty of ice. Yum.We then ordered for some food - I went for the fish finger sandwich knowing it was a little while before I would eat again in the evening. It arrived promptly and looked amazing - towered lightly battered fish in a brioche bun with a side of fries. The batter was fab - not too heavy with the batter but lovely and crispy! Given the warm day and the atmosphere this place was exactly what we needed for a quick catch up in London when we needed it! Spot on - staff friendly and clean bar and toilets!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Towering fish finger sandwich!
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Aperol spritz

g8kIC1gJJKq9l7s-j2yQSg.text: Stopped in with my husband the night we landed in London on our honeymoon. It was a lovely first British night out--the pub was beautiful, the beer was tasty and the food was delicious--especially the salt and pepper mussels. Bartenders and staff very friendly, as well!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. Pulled pork sliders, scotch egg, salt and pepper mussels, and beer
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. The inside
Photo of The Marquis Cornwallis - London, United Kingdom. The outside
